author: Annie Gasparro
title: Kelloggâ€™s Cereal Struggles Continue
text:
Kellogg Co. has tried new products, like Cinnamon Frosted Flakes and Special K with probiotics, but the company said Thursday that Americans are still eating less cereal.
Health-focused, adult-oriented varieties have suffered in particular as those customers switch to other breakfast foods entirely. The maker of Frosted Flakes and Froot Loops has struggled for years as Americans have given up breakfast cereal for Greek-style yogurt and breakfast bars that contain more protein and less sugar.
